bibl.title: Letter from John A. Owen, Jr., to Philip Showalter Hench, December 30, 1947

div1.p: Owen, Jr., believes that Alpha Omega Alpha will react favorably to Hench's suggestion that Kean, Cooke, and Moran be made honorary members.

div1.head: Letter from John A. Owen, Jr., to Philip Showalter Hench, December 30, 1947
div1.p:
What with the Christmas vacation,
the AOA correspondence must of necessity be-
come somewhat irregular and informal. I
was able, however, to get the prints made
at once without any trouble at all and
I presume you have them now. Please
don't think of paying for them- con-
sider them merely as a Christmas present
from the chapter here.

I appreciate again your suggestion as
to honorary members; while I haven't
talked it over with the rest of the society,
I am fairly sure they will consider it
favorably. At any event, however, we won't
be able to have Mr. Moran here as we
have already scheduled the ceremonies for
nearly a month earlier; that's unfortunate.

Thank you for your interest in us,
and personally and on behalf of the chap-
ter, let me wish you and Mrs. Hench
a very happy New Year.
